The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

San Jose City College Health Services Program Receives $4,000 Grant from the California Family Health Council
	 
San Jose, CA.  The California Family Health Council has recently awarded San Jose City College Health Services a $4,000 grant to continue their outreach and educational activities relating to sexually transmitted infections (STI). The California Family Health Council is a non-profit organization assisting eligible health care providers.
The funded project activities will include:
Recognition of World AIDS Day on campus
Campus-wide educational  PowerPoint format viewable on all college building monitors,
Expanded educational power point provided to all SJCC instructors for classroom viewing,
Increasing STI screening of SJCC students; and
Updating of clinical practice for health professionalsâ regarding STI screening, treatment and education.

items.item_details:
San Jose City College Health Services Program Receives $100,000 Grant to Expand Existing Smoking Cessation Program
	 
On November 29, 2012 the San Jose City College Health Services Program received notification from the Smoking Cessation Leadership Center at UC San Francisco and the Pfizer Medical Education Group of New York that it was awarded a two-year, $100,000 grant to expand its existing smoking cessation program by improving clinical practice of health care providers with tobacco education and cessation resources.  The primary objectives of the grant include:  improving clinical practice of health care providers with tobacco education and cessation resources; increasing awareness of smoking cessation programs and services; and develop and pass a formal no-smoking policy district wide.
	 
The grant proposal, "Trash The Ash," was submitted by Health Services Director, Janet Chang, R.N., M.S., on behalf of San Jose City College to the UCSF Smoking Cessation Leadership Center and Pfizer Corporation.  The current grant continues the legacy of work initiated nearly ten years ago, in 2003, when San Jose City College received a grant from the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation to develop a smoking cessation program.  Since 2003, the SJCC Smoking Cessation Program has been coordinated by Jan Reid, R.N., who has offered smoking cessation counseling sessions, supplies and services to interested smokers.

This Bond List Revision reflects the efforts to plan and prioritize Measure G-2004 Bond projects at San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College and for District projects. The changes included in this Bond List Revision address project consolidations to gain efficiency in projects and economy of scale, and incorporate additional funding in the form of interest earned on bond funds in the manner agreed upon by District and College administrations. Contracts
	 
Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) – URS CORPORATION – Geotechnical Services at EVC Automotive Technology Project
	 
In conjunction with the replacement of the EVC Auto Tech building, a Geotechnical analysis is necessary to meet the requirements of California Geological Survey, Note 48.  Proposals were sought from the firms approved by the Board on August 14, 2012.  Four responses were received and based on those it is recommended that URS Corporation be awarded a contract for in the amount of $74,416 to provide Geotechnical services for the Automotive Technology Project for conformance with CGS-Note 48.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the award of a contract to URS CORPORATION for geotechnical services in conjunction with the EVC Automotive Technology project in the amount of $74,416.
	 
DOUGHERTY + DOUGHERTY ARCHITECTS LLP - PAA EVC-01 –– Programming and Schematic Design Services
	 
In keeping with the Evergreen Valley College 2025 Facilities Master Plan, the District issued a Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for Professional Design Services to perform programming and design services of various projects, including the Administration/Student Services Remodel project.  Outreach efforts included posting to the District Purchasing website and direct contact by e-mail and phone to 12 minority and woman-owned small disadvantaged businesses.
	 
On February 21, 2012, the District received a Statement of Qualifications (SOQ) from twenty-one (21) firms in response to the RFQ.  A selection committee consisting of representatives from the District and Evergreen Valley College reviewed each SOQ. The committee discussed the SOQ’s received and ranked the firms.  From those rankings, the committee selected six (6) firms to be invited for presentation/interview for the Admin/Student Services Remodel project (in alphabetical order):
	 
Aedis / Carrier-Johnson  (SBE)
Dougherty & Dougherty Architecture
HMC Architects  (SBE)
Lionakis
Ratcliff
tBP Architecture
	 
The interviews were held on March 9, 2012.  Based on a combination of qualifications and interview scores, the committee selected DOUGHERTY + DOUGHERTY ARCHITECTS LLP for this project.  The College delayed a request to the Board for approval until now to allow it to finalize its priorities and fully develop its approach to expenditures related to the Measure G-2010 projects.
	 
The Board is asked to approve issuance of PAA EVC-01 to  DOUGHERTY + DOUGHERTY ARCHITECTS LLP, in the amount of $134,410 for the Administration / Student Services Remodel Project.
	 
Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) – ARTIK ART & ARCHITECTURE – SLCC-01 Photolab Design Services
	 
In conjunction with the Theater & Vocational Technology Building project, it is necessary to relocate the Photography department from their current location in the 100 Wing Building at SJCC to the 3rd floor of the High Tech Center. This consolidates film and digital photography classrooms into one location and makes available the space in the 100 Wing Building for the Vocational Technology Building project. Artik was selected from the firms approved by the Board on August 14, 2012 to provide programming, design and construction administration services for this project. 
	 
The Board is asked to approve PAA SJCC-01 to ARTIK ART & ARCHITECTURE in the amount of $89,000 for Architect of Record (AOR) services for the Photo Lab Relocation Project.
	 
	 
Contract Revisions and Changes 
Revision #2 to ALLANA BUICK AND BERS, INC. (ABB) PAA EVC-01 –– EVC Gullo Student Center Envelope Upgrade Project
	 
The Gullo Student Services Center at EVC has experienced roof and wall leaks for many years.  The leaks have caused interior damage and pose potential risk to equipment.  ABB was selected in competition with two other firms because of its expertise in building exterior envelope investigation.  The Board approved a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) to (ABB) on May 8, 2012 to provide a condition assessment and design services related to the issues with the building’s roof.  As a result of that condition assessment it was found that the building’s exterior wall was in need of repair as well.
	 
Revision No. 1 to this amendment, approved by the Board on July 10, 2012, provided a detailed assessment and the design services required to correct the exterior wall system of the Gullo Student Services Center at EVC.  It was originally thought that the scope of work would not require involvement of the Division of State Architect (DSA).  However, it became apparent as assessment and design progressed that the extent of the construction work involved will require review and approval from DSA. This Revision No. 2 provides for the additional services required to include design and administration needed to achieve approval from DSA at the completion of construction.
	 
Original agreement - $95,490
Revision No. 1 - $101,460
Revision No. 2 - $77,000
Revised Contract Value – $273,950
	 
The Board is asked to approve Revision #2 to ALLANA BUICK and BERS, INC. PAA EVC-01 in the amount of $77,000 for the EVC Gullo Student Center Envelope Upgrade Project.
	 
Revision #2 to CSW/STUBER-STROEH ENGINEERING GROUP, INC. (CSW/ST2) PAA EVC-01 ––EVC and District Offices Utility Mapping
	 
This revision in the amount of $3,200 includes professional design fees as requested by the College to the addition of hydronic piping to the Utility Maps.  The scope of work consists of adding hot and chilled water pipe routing to the Utility Maps already prepared by CSW/STUBER-STROEH ENGINEERING GROUP, INC. for the Evergreen Valley College.
	 
The original agreement amount is $251,851.  The new contract value including all revisions will be $260,583.   
	 
The Board is asked to approve Revision #2 to CSW/STUBER STROEH ENGINEERING GROUP, INC PAA EVC-01 in the amount of $3,200 for the Evergreen and District Offices Utility Mapping Project.
	 
	 
Revision No. 01 to SIMPSON GUMPERTZ AND HEGER, INC. Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) – SJCC Jaguar Gym Roof Replacement Project Design Services.
	 
In March of 2012, SIMPSON GUMPERTZ AND HEGER, INC. was selected to provide design services to replace the roof of the Jaguar Gym at San Jose City College.  In April of 2012 an ICA was executed between SIMPSON GUMPERTZ AND HEGER, INC. and the San Jose Evergreen Community College District for $80,750.  During design it became apparent that the replacement of the scoreboards would be required due to the age and ongoing maintenance issues prevalent with the two existing scoreboards.  This revision provides for the additional services requested to design and administer the scope noted above.
	 
Original agreement - $80,750
Revision No. 01 - $12,000
Revised contract value - $92,750
	 
The Board is asked to approve Revision #1 to the ICA with SIMPSON GUMPERTZ & HEGER, INC. in the amount of $12,000 to for additional design services for the Jaguar Gym Roof Replacement Project.
	 
	 
Bond List Revisions 
Bond List Revision #2 for Measure G-2010 was approved by the Board on June 12, 2012.
	 
Proposed Bond List Revision #3 reflects the efforts to plan and prioritize Measure G-2010 Bond projects at San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College.  There are no revisions to District projects in this request. The changes included in this Bond List Revision align project scope and budget with planned implementation efforts for the respective college Facilities Master Plans to gain efficiency and economy of scale, and to allocate additional funding in the form of interest earned on bond funds in the manner agreed upon by District and College administrations.
	 
The Board is asked to approve Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #3 as detailed in the attached Measure G-2010 Bond Project List.

As part of the ongoing review and updating of Board Policies, the Board of Trustees held a special study session to revisit the District Mission (Board Policy 1200) and Vision (Board Policy 1300) statements to revise and update each during a special study session held on June 30, 2012. 
	 
At the end of the District Council summer "break," the Board's draft document containing this updated language was presented to District Council members at their regularly scheduled meeting on September 20, 2012 with the request that it be further shared with constituent groups for feedback and recommendations prior to the November 15th District Council meeting. The only change to the document language came via Evergreen College with a revision of their Mission and Vision Statements to reflect the latest approved versions. 
	 
On November 15th, the District Council recommended that the attached draft District Mission and Vision Statements (as originally drafted by the Board of Trustees without amended language) be forwarded to the Chancellor and subsequently to the Board for approval. 
	 
After approval, the District Mission (Board Policy 1200) and Vision (Board Policy 1300) will replace the existing and approved January 10, 2006 policies.

At the November 27, 2012, meeting of the Board of Trustees several members of the community presented comments on an item not on the agenda;  specifically an incident that occurred on Thanksgiving Day during the "Big Bone"  annual football contest involving Lincoln High School and San Jose High School in which items belonging to several of the high school players were stolen from the locker room.  Because the locker room had been previously utilized by San Jose City basketball players, who were practicing for a subsequent game; Campus Police, who was present to cover the athletic event, documented the incident, wrote a report and began an investigation process.
	 
The purpose of this report is to present a timeline of events, provide a status update and, against this background, respond to the concerns raised during the public comments.  Most important of all, this item will present proposed strategies for moving forward in a constructive manner that will result in the best outcomes for our students, faculty, staff and members of our community.
